review: I bought Chromecast 20 months ago, it has quirks and annoyances but basically works.  Today (5/21/2015) it disabled itself pending new permissions.  To continue using, Google now requires permission to read and modify all data on all websites you visit.  I'm not joking or exaggerating, that's what it said.  There is no way I am giving them that permission to read and modify my personal information.  Google makes a lot of money selling web users' personal data, I'm going to do my best to keep my data out of their hands.  Not always easy to do, but in this case it was easy enough to unplug Chromecast from my TV and delete the app from my computer.

review: Shipped and received in 2 business days! Have played around with it for 1 day, mostly YouTube and casting the chrome screen from my laptop. Have casted from 3 different phones in the house. Very little setup and worked like a charm out of the box. There are some glitches though in terms of phone freezing or video continuing to play on TV even when I stop casting. There seems to be a lag or outright disconnect at times. Not sure if this is related to WiFi connection or the phone or the chromecast device itself. Will try and figure this out and hope to see less of this in the future.
